content: Government Bailouts... Good for America? "http://www.personalliberty.com/economic-bailouts-poll-results/" Here are the results! The Total Number of people who voted in this poll: 358716 1) Who is most to blame for America’s current economic crisis? 69% voted: Clinton Administration and the Democrats in Congress 11% voted: The Bush Administration 3% voted: Wall Street 13% voted: Banks and sub-prime lenders 2% voted: Real estate and mortgage professionals 0% voted: Investors 1% voted: Home buyers 2) Do you agree government bailouts are the answer to America’s financial crisis? 7% voted: Yes 88% voted: No 5% voted: Undecided 3) Do you believe the American taxpayers should have to foot the bill for our financial systems mistakes? 7% voted: Yes, we have to or we’ll end up in a prolonged recession or worse a depression. 22% voted: No, America is too far in debt already. 69% voted: Absolutely not, the American people should never be responsible for bailing out the private sector. 2% voted: Undecided 4) Do you believe the government bailouts will ultimately rescue our country's financial system? 8% voted: Yes 86% voted: No 6% voted: Undecided 5) Do you believe Barack Obama was the best choice to handle the country's future economic policy? 12% voted: Yes 85% voted: No 3% voted: Undecided
reply: Government Bailouts... Good for America? "http://www.personalliberty.com/economic-bailouts-poll-results/" Here are the results! title: Government Bailouts...Good for America???

content: I know since Obama has been in the White House many of you out there believe this bad economy is his fault. However, it is not. It is a bad economy that both Clinton and Bush let go with no over sight and no regulation. The greedy people in this country had a field day. Now Obama is trying to do the right thing, the right thing he feels will help make our economy strong once again. It will take years to do but we have no choice. We simply must have to shell out more of our hard earned money to cover the sins of others. Its like when a shop lifter steals from your favorite clothing store. You didn't have anything to do with it but the store owner has to make up the loss some how.
reply: I know since Obama has been in the White House many of you out there believe this bad economy is his fault. However, it is not. content: quote: Originally posted by busnrete8: quote: Originally posted by Grachus: Err, could it be that those who take the poll have a bias? This some sort of "broad sample" of of American Opinion? But thanks for the link - interesting site. Dave Do you know of ANY poll that does NOT have a built in bias? Gee, could it be how the question is phrased? Those 'meaningless' tea parties (or pelosi's reference to them as astro turf) will bite back! Did I say the poll was biased? If I did, my bad. But to take a poll of Libertarians who are inherently against ANY government action OR ANY government regulation, and expect this to be representative of America is naive. Nor do I think the people who ran that poll thought the response was representative of America - I don't see that claim anywhere on this site. In no way, shape, manner or form am I calling this a biased poll of Libertarians! It's certainly representative of THIS Libertarian group. In fact I'm surprised that eight percent were in favor of the bailout. Dave
quote: Originally posted by busnrete8: quote: Originally posted by Grachus: Err, could it be that those who take the poll have a bias? This some sort of "broad sample" of of American Opinion? But thanks for the link - interesting site. Dave Do you know of ANY poll that does NOT have a built in bias? Gee, could it be how the question is phrased? Those 'meaningless' tea parties (or pelosi's reference to them as astro turf) will bite back!
reply: Did I say the poll was biased? If I did, my bad. But to take a poll of Libertarians who are inherently against ANY government action OR ANY government regulation, and expect this to be representative of America is naive. Nor do I think the people who ran that poll thought the response was representative of America - I don't see that claim anywhere on this site. In no way, shape, manner or form am I calling this a biased poll of Libertarians! It's certainly representative of THIS Libertarian group. In fact I'm surprised that eight percent were in favor of the bailout. Dave
title: Government Bailouts...Good for America???

content: Interesting the site was not honest enough to post the standard disclaimer " This poll is not scientific and reflects the opinions of only those Internet users who have chosen to participate." When a internet site does a poll its always skewed toward its targeted readership. If daily kos did the same poll the results would be 100% the other way -- and still a cr*p poll.
reply: Interesting the site was not honest enough to post the standard disclaimer " This poll is not scientific and reflects the opinions of only those Internet users who have chosen to participate." When a internet site does a poll its always skewed toward its targeted readership. If daily kos did the same poll the results would be 100% the other way -- and still a cr*p poll.
